issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.
resolution.name: Duplicate

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: The current Netty 4 version is 4.1.0.Beta5.  We should bump it to a non-beta version.

This message was automatically generated.

Hi Nicholas,

* What is the target version for this JIRA?
* Are the code changes due to API changes in Netty? If so, this might not be eligible for 2.x due to impact on downstream classpaths.
* Also please do not use wildcard imports.

The target is trunk.  We may skip branch-2.

> Are the code changes due to API changes in Netty?

Yes.

> Also please do not use wildcard imports.

Why?  The imports are fixed automatically by IDE.  I think we should not spend time on fixing imports manually.
h11168_20161123.patch: fixes test failures and warnings.

This message was automatically generated.

bq. The target is trunk. We may skip branch-2.

Okay. Could you please set a target version? Also please update the JIRA summary with the precise version of Netty that we are upgrading to.

bq. Why? The imports are fixed automatically by IDE. I think we should not spend time on fixing imports manually.

Couple reasons:

* Wildcard imports pollute the namespace
* It makes it unclear what classes are being added or removed for changes like this
* An IDE will do the imports for you. If you increase the auto-wildcard threshold in your IDE to a large value, you just delete the wildcard import and hit the IDE shortcut.

This message was automatically generated.

Resolving as duplicate, but the lineage is confusing. HDFS-11498 dropped the version from 4.1.0.Beta5 to 4.0.23.Final, then it was bumped to 4.0.52.Final in HDFS-14910. If we revisit the version of netty we're shipping, it should probably be in a new JIRA
